title: Kashmir:As Unofficial Delegation Of MEPs Continue Their Tour In Kashmir, Five More Migrant Workers Shot Dead By Terrorists
text:
As Unofficial Delegation Of MEPs Continue Their Tour In Kashmir, Five More Migrant Workers Shot Dead By Terrorists

As Unofficial Delegation Of MEPs Continue Their Tour In Kashmir, Five More Migrant Workers Shot Dead By Terrorists

Five migrant labourers, all of them hailing from West Bengal were shot dead by terrorists in south Kashmir’s Kulgam district on Tuesday.

The migrant workers who were working as masons and carpenters were staying in a rented accommodation in Katrasu. The terrorists reportedly barged inside the accommodation, dragged them out, and then shot them.

West Bengal: Family & friends of the five labourers (who were shot dead by terrorists in Kulgam, Jammu and Kashmir yesterday) in mourning in Murshidabad. pic.twitter.com/oeVbHxubnk — ANI (@ANI) October 30, 2019

While five of them were killed in the attack, another is still battling for his life in a local hospital. There are also reports that three of their fellow men are missing after the attack.

Tuesday's killing is the 11th such case in the valley in the last 15 days where non-Kashmiris have come under attack by terrorists.

Don't Miss 481 SHARES 279 SHARES 1.5 K SHARES 2.4 K SHARES

BCCL/ REPRESENTATIONAL IMAGE

Last week, two non-Kashmiris who had gone to the valley to transport apples were shot dead by terrorists in the Shopian district and their truck was set on fire.

There were two previous incidents where apple traders and transporters were killed and in a separate incident, another migrant worker was killed by the terrorists.

Tuesday's killings came at a time when an unofficial delegation of EU far-right parliamentarians is visiting the valley to take stock of the situation.

BCCL

The 23-member delegation is in the valley on the invite of an NGO Women’s Economic and Social Think Tank (WESTT) which is run by a woman called Madi Sharma who describes herself as an international business broker.

Even though the delegation which reached the valley on Tuesday is set to meet the locals and talk to them about the prevailing situation there, it is looking more like a guided tour.

BCCL

Congress slammed the visit of a group of Members of the European Parliament (MEP) to Kashmir as an “ill-advised PR exercise”.

PIB

Senior Congress leader Anand Sharma described the visit by the group of MEPs to Kashmir as a “national embarrassment” and demanded that those responsible should be held accountable.

“The government embarked on an ill-advised PR exercise, sponsoring individuals with questionable credentials.”
description: Five migrant labourers, all of them hailing from West Bengal were shot dead by terrorists in south Kashmir’s Kulgam district on Tuesday. The migrant workers who were working as masons and carpenters were staying in a rented accommodation in Katrasu. The terrorists reportedly barged inside the accommodation, dragged them out, and then shot them.
